section.section:
For purposes of this section, an "immediate threat" exists if any meat, seafood, poultry, vegetable, fruit, or any other perishable substance that is intended for consumption as food:
Contains any filthy, decomposed, or putrid substance;
Is poisonous or otherwise would be injurious to health if consumed; or
Is otherwise unsafe.
If a food poses an immediate threat, it shall be considered a public nuisance.

text.section: If the Secretary finds that a food poses an immediate threat, the Secretary immediately shall destroy the food or otherwise make the food unusable for consumption by human beings.
The owner of a substance that is destroyed or otherwise made unusable under this section may bring a suit for damages against the Secretary.
The Secretary shall have the immunity from liability described under § 5-633 of the Courts and Judicial Proceedings Article.
